posts.post_content:
Turn One: Moutain, [Skirk Prospector](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Skirk Prospector)   
Turn Two: Mountain, [Mogg War Marshal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mogg War Marshal), sacrifise Mogg, play [Brightstone Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brightstone Ritual), summon [Goblin Chieftain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Chieftain), attack for solid 8 on round two, serious damage considering the game progress, which could bring you a fine position for following turns (the game will probably end in your favor on turn three or four, unless your opponent will come with something unpredictable, like [Hulk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hulk) [Flash](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Flash) combo)
  
   
not considering options that you have in your hand another Mogg, Ritual, Chieftain or whatever (you can see I'm not mentioning popular [Goblin Piledriver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Piledriver); well, that's because not everybody, including me, could afford set of these for about 70-80 $...)
  
   
simple and effective, of course you can imagine way better scenarios with goblins, but these "senzational combos" would happen occasionally in comparison to the simple ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

not considering options that you have in your hand another Mogg, Ritual, Chieftain or whatever (you can see I'm not mentioning popular Goblin Piledriver; well, that's because not everybody, including me, could afford set of these for about 70-80 $...)

posts.post_content:
Strictly better than Krenko's Command/ Dragon Fodder. Summoning sickness for the token put into play the next turn is trivial.  
  
Can be tutored with [Goblin Matron](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Matron) or [Boggart Harbinger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boggart Harbinger). Can be raised from the grave with a number of cards. Combos with [Knucklebone Witch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Knucklebone Witch), [Boggart Shenanigans](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boggart Shenanigans), and [Warren Weirding](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Warren Weirding). Most importantly it gives you extra fodder for a turn without subtracting a token.  
  
You're mad if you pay the echo cost.
posts.html:
Strictly better than Krenko's Command/ Dragon Fodder. Summoning sickness for the token put into play the next turn is trivial.

Can be tutored with Goblin Matron or Boggart Harbinger. Can be raised from the grave with a number of cards. Combos with Knucklebone Witch, Boggart Shenanigans, and Warren Weirding. Most importantly it gives you extra fodder for a turn without subtracting a token.

You're mad if you pay the echo cost.

posts.post_content:
Not strictly better than [Dragon Fodder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dragon Fodder) since the one token you get if you sacrifice him is in summoning sickness for the turn.  
  
Now if you had 3 mana, you could play him and [Goblin Grenade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Grenade) for 5 free damage, or you could play a [Goblin Chieftain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Chieftain) next turn to give the 2nd one haste.
posts.html:
Not strictly better than Dragon Fodder since the one token you get if you sacrifice him is in summoning sickness for the turn.

posts.post_content: This card is better than Dragon Fodder, for the reason the next turn if the person attacks, well you can block with this and get another token... Though... In a token deck I rather run [Dragon Fodder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dragon Fodder), since with [Parallel Lives](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Parallel Lives) I get straight away 4 tokens that CAN attack next turn, as this stalls for Token decks... But this in Goblin deck is 100x better.
